thread.title: Girls tennis: Ivenitsky reaches section finals
thread.title_full: Girls tennis: Ivenitsky reaches section finals

author: J.B. Cozens
title: Girls tennis: Ivenitsky reaches section finals
text:
By J.B. Cozens on October 22,   
John Jay senior Anya Ivenitsky advanced to today’s Section 1 girls tennis singles championship match, after pulling a three-set win over Courtney Ollis of Suffern on Wednesday in the semifinals. 
She faces fourth-seeded Sydney Kaplan of Suffern in today’s final, at Harrison High School. 
Ivenitsky lost the first set on Wednesday to Ollis on a tiebreaker, but came back to win the next two sets, and the match, 6-7 (5-7), 6-3, 6-3. 
Kaplan scored a three-set win over Maranda Sears of Arlington in the other semifinal, 2-6, 6-1, 7-5. 
Ivenitsky is the first John Jay girls tennis player to ever reach the section finals. She also qualified for the state tournament. She is only the second John Jay girls tennis player to do so — and the first since CeCe Crystal in 2006, after finishing third at sectionals. 
She is only the third John Jay tennis player, boy or girl, to ever reach the section championship match, the others being Nick Crystal in 2011 and Hayden Cassone last spring. 
The state tournament will be held Oct. 31-Nov. 2 at Tri-City Fitness in Latham. 
Ivenitsky, John Jay’s number-one singles player during the season, has won all three of her matches in the section tournament in three sets. 
In the quarterfinals on Tuesday, also at Harrison High School, she rallied from a set down to beat the second seed, Mayu Tezuka of Keio Academy, 3-6, 6-1, 6-2. 
She went to three sets to win her first-round match in a marathon, beating Ashley Granieri of Scarsdale, 6-1, 4-6, 7-5. Anya Ivenitsky is the first John Jay girls tennis player to ever reach the finals of the Section 1 singles tournament. — J.B. Cozens photo Related posts:
